info.title: Agave Platform Science API
info.description: Power your digital lab and reduce the time from theory to discovery using the Agave Science-as-a-Service API Platform. Agave provides hosted services that allow researchers to manage data, conduct experiments, and publish and share results from anywhere at any time.

scopes.PRODUCTION: Catchall scope for all core services

get.description: List existing clients

post.description: Create a new client

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The api client to create

400.description: Raised if a user supplies an invalid username format

404.description: The user profile cannot be found

default.description: The service was unable to query the profile database

get.description: Returns a detailed description of a named client.

parameters.name: clientName
parameters.description: The name of the client to be deleted

delete.description: Immediately deletes this client and renders the API keys useless.

parameters.name: clientName
parameters.description: The name of the client to be deleted

get.description: Lists all APIs to which the client is subscribed

parameters.name: clientName
parameters.description: The name of the client to be deleted

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results returned from this query

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of results skipped in the result set returned from this query

post.description: Add a new API subscription to the given client

parameters.name: clientName
parameters.description: The name of the client to be subscribe to this api

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The api client to create

delete.description: Unsubscribe the client from all APIs

parameters.name: clientName
parameters.description: The name of the client to be deleted

get.description: Get a list of available applications.

parameters.name: public
parameters.description: Whether to return only public apps. (Acceptable values are: "true", "false")

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the app

parameters.name: executionSystem
parameters.description: The execution system of the system

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: A free text tag associated with an app

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results returned from this query

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of results skipped in the result set returned from this query

post.description: Register and update new applications.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The description of the app to add or update.

get.description: Get details of an application by it's unique id.

parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: The id of the application. The application id is made up of the name and version separated by a dash.

parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: The id of the application. The application id is made up of the name and version separated by a dash.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The operation to perform.

post.description: Update an application.

parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: The id of the application. The application id is made up of the name and version separated by a dash.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The description of the app to add or update.

delete.description: Deletes an application.

parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: The id of the application. The application id is made up of the name and version separated by a dash.

get.description: Get the permission for this application.

parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: The id of the application. The application id is made up of the name and version separated by a dash.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results returned from this query

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of results skipped in the result set returned from this query

post.description: Grant a user permission for an application.

parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: The id of the application. The application id is made up of the name and version separated by a dash.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The permission add or update.

delete.description: Deletes all permissions on an application.

parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: The id of the application. The application id is made up of the name and version separated by a dash.

get.description: Get a specific user's permissions for an application.

parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: The id of the application. The application id is made up of the name and version separated by a dash.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The username of the api user associated with the permission.

post.description: Add or update a user's permission for an application.

parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: The id of the application. The application id is made up of the name and version separated by a dash.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The username of the api user associated with the permission

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The permission add or update.

delete.description: Deletes all permissions for the given user on an application.

parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: The id of the application. The application id is made up of the name and version separated by a dash.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The username of the api user associated with the permission

get.description: Get a submission form for the named application.

parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: The app for which to create the form

get.description: Download a file from the user's default storage location.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the file relative to the user's default storage location.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Boolean flag to indicate whether the Content-Disposition header should be set to force browser file download.

put.description: Perform an action on a file or folder.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the file relative to the user's default storage location.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The operation to perform.

post.description: Import file item from a remote URL to the target system

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The relative or absolute path where the file item should be imported

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The import request

delete.description: Deletes a file or folder on the user's default storage system.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the file relative to the user's default storage location.

get.description: Download a file from the given system

parameters.name: systemId
parameters.description: The unique id of the system on which the data resides.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the file relative to the user's default storage location.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Boolean flag to indicate whether the Content-Disposition header should be set to force a browser download.

put.description: Perform an action on a file or folder.

parameters.name: systemId
parameters.description: The unique id of the system on which the data resides.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the file relative to the user's default storage location.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The operation to perform.

post.description: Import file item from a remote URL to the target system

parameters.name: systemId
parameters.description: The id of the system.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The relative or absolute path where the file item should be imported

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The import request

delete.description: Deletes a file or folder at the specified path on the specified remote system.

parameters.name: systemId
parameters.description: The unique id of the system on which the data resides.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the file relative to the user's default storage location.

get.description: Get a remote directory listing on a specific system.

parameters.name: systemId
parameters.description: The unique id of the system on which the data resides.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the file relative to the user's default storage location.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results returned from this query

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of results skipped in the result set returned from this query

get.description: List all the share permissions for a file or folder.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the file relative to the user's default storage location.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results returned from this query

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of results skipped in the result set returned from this query

post.description: Update permissions for a single user on their default storage system.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the file relative to the user's default storage location.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The permission add or update.

get.description: List all the share permissions for a file or folder.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the file relative to the user's default storage location.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results returned from this query

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of results skipped in the result set returned from this query

parameters.name: systemId
parameters.description: The system id

post.description: Update permissions for a single user.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the file relative to the user's default storage location.

parameters.name: systemId
parameters.description: The id of the system on which the file resides

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The updated permission value

delete.description: Deletes all permissions on a file except those of the owner.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the file relative to the user's default storage location.

parameters.name: systemId
parameters.description: The id of the system on which the file item lives.

get.description: Get a list of jobs the authenticated user had submitted.

parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: The id of the app run by the job.

parameters.name: archive
parameters.description: Boolean flag stating whether the job output was archived. (Acceptable values are: "true", "false")

parameters.name: archivePath
parameters.description: Path on the archive system where the job output was archived if the archive flag was true.

parameters.name: archiveSystem
parameters.description: The id of the system where the job output was archived if the archive flag was true.

parameters.name: batchQueue
parameters.description: The system queue in which the job ran.

parameters.name: executionSystem
parameters.description: The execution system where the job ran.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the job.

parameters.name: inputs
parameters.description: The job inputs. Note, this is a partial text search.

parameters.name: localId
parameters.description: The local job id of the job on the execution system.

parameters.name: maxRuntime
parameters.description: The maximum run time of the job in HH:mm:ss format.

parameters.name: memoryPerNode
parameters.description: The memory requested by the job specified in GB.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the job.

parameters.name: nodeCount
parameters.description: The number of nodes requested for the job.

parameters.name: outputPath
parameters.description: The remote work directory path of the job.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: The job parameters. Note, this is a partial text search.

parameters.name: processorsPerNode
parameters.description: The number of processors per node requested by the job.

parameters.name: retries
parameters.description: The number of retry attempts made on this job.

parameters.name: startTime
parameters.description: The date the job began running. Results are rounded by day. You may specify using YYYY-MM-DD format or free form timeframes such as 'yesterday' or '3 days ago'.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The job status.

parameters.name: submitTime
parameters.description: The date the job was submitted to the remote execution system to run. Results are rounded by day. You may specify using YYYY-MM-DD format or free form timeframes such as 'yesterday' or '3 days ago'.

parameters.name: visible
parameters.description: Boolean flag indicating whether or not to show deleted jobs. Defaults to false. (Acceptable values are: "true", "false")

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Boolean flag indicating whether or not to show deleted jobs. Defaults to false.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Boolean flag indicating whether or not to show deleted jobs. Defaults to false.

post.description: Submit a new job request.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The JSON description of the job to submit.

get.description: Get details of the job with the specific job id.

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: The id of the job.

post.description: Resubmits the job with the given job id as a new job with a unique id.

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: The id of the job to resubmit

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The resubmit action request

delete.description: Deletes a job from the user's history.

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: The id of the job.

get.description: Get the permissions granted for this job.

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: The id of the job.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results returned from this query

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of results to skip in the result set for this query

post.description: Add a user permission for the given job.

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: The id of the job.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The permission add or update.

delete.description: Deletes all permissions on an job.

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: The id of the job.

get.description: Get a specific user's permissions for a job.

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: The id of the job.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The username of the api user associated with the permission.

post.description: Update a user permission for the given job and username

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: The id of the job for which the permissions will be updated

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The user for whom the permission will be udpated

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The permission to update

delete.description: Deletes all permissions for the given user on an job.

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: The id of the job for which to delete the user permissions.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The username for whom to delete permissions

get.description: Get the status of the job.

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: The id of the job.

get.description: List the output folder for a job.

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: The id of the job.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path to an output file or folder relative to the job output directory. This resource will follow data around as it moves from the execution system to archival storage.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results returned from this query

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of results skipped in the result set returned from this query

get.description: List and/or search metadata.

400.description: Raised if a user does not supply a UUID or supplies an invalid JSON query

parameters.description: A timestamp indicating the earliest time of the first monitor check in ISO 8601 format

parameters.description: A timestamp indicating the latest time of the first monitor check in ISO 8601 format

parameters.name: result
parameters.description: A timestamp indicating the latest time of the first monitor check in ISO 8601 format

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The max number of results.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of records to when returning the results. When paginating results, the page number = ceil(offset/limit)

ApplicationParameterStringValue.title: ApplicationParameterStringValue
ApplicationParameterStringValue.description: An ApplicationParameter representing a string value

ApplicationParameterBooleanValue.description: An ApplicationParameter representing a boolean value

ApplicationParameterNumericValue.title: ApplicationParameterNumericValue
ApplicationParameterNumericValue.description: An ApplicationParameter representing a numeric value

type.description: The primary type of this parameter

ApplicationParameterFlagValue.title: ApplicationParameterFlagValue
ApplicationParameterFlagValue.description: An ApplicationParameter representing a flag value

type.description: The primary type of this parameter

key.description: The API key for this client.

secret.description: The API secret for this client.

callbackUrl.description: Callback URL for OAuth authentication grant.

description.description: Description of the client. This will be shown to users when authentication via OAuth web flows

tier.description: The access tier for this client.

description.description: Description of the client. This will be shown to users when authentication via OAuth web flows

tier.description: The access tier for this client.

callbackUrl.description: Callback URL for OAuth authentication grant.

apiContext.description: The base url path of the API.

apiProvider.description: The user who registered the API.

apiVersion.description: The current major version of the API. This is appended to the api_context to create the base API url.

status.description: The current status of the API.

tier.description: The access tier for this client.

tier.description: The access tier for this client.

ApplicationSummary.title: ApplicationSummary
ApplicationSummary.description: An abbreviated Application object returned in request in application collection queries

id.description: Unique id of this app. Comprised of the app name-version.

executionSystem.description: The system id of the execution system where this app should run.

lastModified.description: The date this application was last modified in ISO 8601 format.

name.description: The name of the application. The name does not have to be unique, but the combination of name and version does.

isPublic.description: Whether the application is public or private.

revision.description: The number of times this application has been revised.

shortDescription.description: The short description of this application.

version.description: The version of the application in #.#.# format. While the version does not need to be unique, the combination of name and version does have to be unique.

Application.title: Application
Application.description: Applications are a self-describing representation of an executable software item. See the App Management Tutorial for more information.

defaultMaxRunTime.description: The max execution time that should be used if none is given in a job description. Ignore if the system does not support schedulers.

defaultMemoryPerNode.description: The default memory in GB to pass to the scheduler if none is given in the job description. This must be less than the max memory parameter in the target queue definition.

defaultNodeCount.description: The number of nodes that should be used if none is given in a job description. Ignore if the system does not support schedulers.

defaultProcessorsPerNode.description: The number of processors to pass to the scheduler if none are given in the job description. This must be 1 if the app is serial.

defaultQueue.description: The queue on the execution system that should be used if none is given in a job description. Ignore if the system does not support schedulers.

deploymentPath.description: The location in the user's default storage system containing the application wrapper and dependencies.

deploymentSystem.description: The system id of the storage system where this app should run.

executionSystem.description: The system id of the execution system where this app should run.

executionType.description: The execution type of the application. If you're unsure, it's probably HPC.

helpURI.description: The URL where users can go for more information about the app.

id.description: Unique id of this app. Comprised of the app name-version.

icon.description: The icon to associate with this app.

inputs.description: The inputs files for this application.

label.description: The label to use when generating forms.

lastModified.description: The date this application was last modified in ISO 8601 format.

longDescription.description: The full text description of this input to use when generating forms.

modules.description: An array of modules to load prior to the execution of the application.

name.description: The name of the application. The name does not have to be unique, but the combination of name and version does.

ontology.description: An array of ontology values describing this application.

outputs.description: The outputs files for this application.

parallelism.description: The parallelism type of the application. If you're unsure, it's probably SERIAL.

parameters.description: The inputs parameters for this application.

isPublic.description: Whether the application is public or private.

revision.description: The number of times this application has been revised.

shortDescription.description: The short description of this application.

tags.description: An array of tags related to this application.

templatePath.description: The path to the wrapper script relative to the deploymentPath.

testPath.description: The path to the test script relative to the deploymentPath.

uuid.description: The UUID of this application. UUID are 36 alphanumeric string.

version.description: The version of the application in #.#.# format. While the version does not need to be unique, the combination of name and version does have to be unique.

ApplicationInput.title: ApplicationInput
ApplicationInput.description: App inputs describe data inputs supported by your app. Each input can represent one or more files or folders. Inptus can be optional or required and may physically reside anywhere accessible using any of the data protocols supported by Agave. Read more.

argument.description: The command line value of this input (ex -n, --name, -name, etc)

showArgument.description: Whether the argument value should be passed into the wrapper at run time

repeatArgument.description: Whether the argument value should be repeated in front of each user-supplied input before injection into the wrapper template at runtime

ApplicationArgumentValue.title: ApplicationArgumentValue
ApplicationArgumentValue.description: Describes the validation, default value, and primary types associated with this ApplicationArgument

defaultValue.description: The default value for this parameter. The type will be determined by the value.type field.

enquote.description: Whether the argument value should be surrounded by quotation marks before injection into the wrapper template at runtime

order.description: The order in which this parameter should be printed when generating an execution command for forked execution. This will also be the order in which paramters are returned in the response json.

required.description: Is this parameter required? If visible is false, this must be true.

validator.description: The regular expression used to validate this parameter value. For enumerations, separate values with |

visible.description: Should this parameter be visible? If not, there must be a default and it will be required.

defaultValue.description: The default value for this parameter. The type will be determined by the value.type field.

enumValues.description: An array of enumerated object values.

enquote.description: Whether the argument value should be surrounded by quotation marks before injection into the wrapper template at runtime

order.description: The order in which this parameter should be printed when generating an execution command for forked execution. This will also be the order in which paramters are returned in the response json.

required.description: Is this parameter required? If visible is false, this must be true.

type.description: The type of this parameter value. (Acceptable values are: "string", "number", "enumeration", "bool", "flag")

validator.description: The regular expression used to validate this parameter value. For enumerations, separate values with |

visible.description: Should this parameter be visible? If not, there must be a default and it will be required.

AgaveResponse.title: AgaveResponse
AgaveResponse.description: This is the wrapper within which all API responses are returned.

FileInfo.title: FileInfo
FileInfo.description: Basic metadata description of a remote file or folder

format.description: The file type of the file.

lastModified.description: The date this file was last modified in ISO 8601 format.

mimeType.description: The mime type of the file/folder. If unknown, it defaults to application/binary.

path.description: The absolute path to the file/folder.

permissions.description: The remote system permission of the invoking user on the file/folder.

system.description: The id of the system where this file lives.

type.description: Whether it is a file or folder.

PermissionRequest.title: PermissionRequest
PermissionRequest.description: A permission request for a given user on the given resource

username.description: The name of the user for this permission object.

PermissionStanza.title: PermissionStanza
PermissionStanza.description: A minimal permission stanza defining read and write permissions

FilePermissionRequest.title: FilePermissionRequest
FilePermissionRequest.description: The permission to apply for the given user onthe given resource

recursive.description: Should updated permissions be applied recursively. Defaults to false.

FileAction.title: FileAction
FileAction.description: A generic action to take on a file item

action.description: Action to perform on the file or folder.

path.description: Name of new directory or target file or folder.

appId.description: The unique name of the application being run by this job. This must be a valid application that the calling user has permission to run.

archive.description: Whether the output from this job should be archived. If true, all new files created by this application's execution will be archived to the archivePath in the user's default storage system.

archivePath.description: The path of the archive folder for this job on the user's default storage sytem.

archiveSystem.description: The unique id of the storage system on which this job's output will be staged.

batchQueue.description: The queue to which this job should be submitted. This is optional and only applies when the execution system has a batch scheduler.

endTime.description: The date the job stopped running due to termination, completion, or error in ISO 8601 format.

executionSystem.description: The system id of the execution system.

id.description: The unique id of the job.

inputs.description: The application specific input files needed for this job. These vary from application to application and should be entered as multiple individual parameters in the form. Inputs may be given as relative paths in the user's default storage system or as URI. If a URI is given, the data will be staged in by the IO service and made avaialble to the application at run time.

localId.description: The process or local job id of the job on the remote execution system.

memoryPerNode.description: The requested memory for this application to run given in GB.

message.description: The error message incurred when the job failed.

nodeCount.description: The number of processors this application should utilize while running. If the application is not of executionType PARALLEL, this should be 1.

notifications.description: An array of notifications you wish to receive.

outputPath.description: Relative path of the job's output data.

parameters.description: The application specific parameters needed for this job. These vary from application to application and should be entered as multiple individual parameters in the form. The actual dataType will be determined by the application description.

processorsPerNode.description: The number of processors this application should utilize while running. If the application is not of executionType PARALLEL, this should be 1.

maxRunTime.description: The requested compute time needed for this application to complete given in HH:mm:ss format.

retries.description: The number of retires it took to submit this job.

startTime.description: The date the job started in ISO 8601 format.

status.description: The status of the job. Possible values are: PENDING, STAGING_INPUTS, CLEANING_UP, ARCHIVING, STAGING_JOB, FINISHED, KILLED, FAILED, STOPPED, RUNNING, PAUSED, QUEUED, SUBMITTING, STAGED, PROCESSING_INPUTS, ARCHIVING_FINISHED, ARCHIVING_FAILED

submitTime.description: The date the job was submitted in ISO 8601 format.

workPath.description: The directory on the remote execution system from which the job is running.

JobRequest.title: JobRequest
JobRequest.description: A request to run a registered app.

appId.description: The unique name of the application being run by this job. This must be a valid application that the calling user has permission to run.

archive.description: Whether the output from this job should be archived. If true, all new files created by this application's execution will be archived to the archivePath in the user's default storage system.

archivePath.description: The path of the archive folder for this job on the user's default storage sytem.

archiveSystem.description: The unique id of the storage system on which this job's output will be staged.

batchQueue.description: The queue to which this job should be submitted. This is optional and only applies when the execution system has a batch scheduler.

inputs.description: The application specific input files needed for this job. These vary from application to application and should be entered as multiple individual parameters in the form. Inputs may be given as relative paths in the user's default storage system or as URI. If a URI is given, the data will be staged in by the IO service and made avaialble to the application at run time.

memoryPerNode.description: The requested memory for this application to run given in GB.

nodeCount.description: The number of processors this application should utilize while running. If the application is not of executionType PARALLEL, this should be 1.

notifications.description: An array of notifications you wish to receive.

parameters.description: The application specific parameters needed for this job. These vary from application to application and should be entered as multiple individual parameters in the form. The actual dataType will be determined by the application description.

processorsPerNode.description: The number of processors this application should utilize while running. If the application is not of executionType PARALLEL, this should be 1.

maxRunTime.description: The requested compute time needed for this application to complete given in HH:mm:ss format.

description.description: A brief description of the event details.

status.description: The status of the job after this event.

JobSubmission.title: JobSubmission
JobSubmission.description: This represents the request made to the Agave jobs api to run a registered application.

archive.description: Whether the output from this job should be archived. If true, all new files created by this application's execution will be archived to the archivePath in the user's default storage system.

archivePath.description: The path of the archive folder for this job on the archiveSystem. Defaults to the user's default storage system.

archiveSystem.description: The system on which the job data will be archived

inputs.description: The application specific input files needed for this job. These vary from application to application and should be entered as multiple individual parameters in the form. Inputs may be given as relative paths in the user's default storage system or as URI. If a URI is given, the data will be staged in by the IO service and made avaialble to the application at run time.

maxMemory.description: The maximum amount of memory needed for this application to run given in GB.

nodeCount.description: The number of nodes this application should utilize while running. If the application is not of executionType PARALLEL, this should be 1.

notifications.description: An array of notifications you wish to receive.

parameters.description: The application specific parameters needed for this job. These vary from application to application and should be entered as multiple individual parameters in the form. The actual dataType will be determined by the application description.

processorsPerNode.description: The number of processors this application should utilize while running.

batchQueue.description: The queue to which this job should be submitted. This is optional and only applies when the execution system has a batch scheduler.

maxRunTime.description: The estimated compute time needed for this application to complete given in hh:mm:ss format.

appId.description: The unique name of the application being run by this job. This must be a valid application that the calling user has permission to run.

parameter1.description: One or more parameters identified in the description of the app you're running.
One or more inputs identified in the description of the app you're running.

appId.description: The unique name of the application being run by this job. This must be a valid application that the calling user has permission to run.

endTime.description: The date the job ended in ISO 8601 format.

executionSystem.description: The system id of the execution system.

id.description: The unique id of the job.

startTime.description: The date the job started in ISO 8601 format.

status.description: The status of the job. Possible values are: PENDING, STAGING_INPUTS, CLEANING_UP, ARCHIVING, STAGING_JOB, FINISHED, KILLED, FAILED, STOPPED, RUNNING, PAUSED, QUEUED, SUBMITTING, STAGED, PROCESSING_INPUTS, ARCHIVING_FINISHED, ARCHIVING_FAILED

id.description: The unique id of the job.

status.description: The status of the job. Possible values are: PENDING, STAGING_INPUTS, CLEANING_UP, ARCHIVING, STAGING_JOB, FINISHED, KILLED, FAILED, STOPPED, RUNNING, PAUSED, QUEUED, SUBMITTING, STAGED, PROCESSING_INPUTS, ARCHIVING_FINISHED, ARCHIVING_FAILED

event.description: The event you wish to recieve a notification about. Specify * for all events.

persistent.description: Whether this event should remain active after it triggers the first time.

url.description: The URI to notify when the import is complete. This can be an email address or URL. If a URL is given, a POST will be made to this address. URL templating is supported. Valid template values are: ${JOB_STATUS}, ${JOB_URL}, ${JOB_ID}, ${JOB_SYSTEM}, ${JOB_NAME}, ${JOB_START_TIME}, ${JOB_END_TIME}, ${JOB_SUBMIT_TIME}, ${JOB_ARCHIVE_PATH}, ${JOB_ARCHIVE_URL}, ${JOB_ERROR}

JobActionType.title: JobActionType
JobActionType.description: The type of action to perform on a job.

JobAction.title: JobAction
JobAction.description: Requests that a management action take place against a job.

action.description: Action to perform on the job.

associationIds.description: UUIDs of associated Agave entities, including the Data to which this Metadata belongs.

created.description: A timestamp indicating when this Metadata was created in the metadata store.

internalUsername.description: The name of the Internal User, if any, who owns this metadata.

lastUpdated.description: A timestamp indicating when this Metadata was last updated in the metadata store.

owner.description: The API user who owns this Metadata.

value.description: A free text or JSON string containing the metadata stored for the given associationIds

created.description: A timestamp indicating when this Metadata was created in the metadata schema store.

internalUsername.description: The name of the Internal User, if any, who owns this schema.

lastUpdated.description: A timestamp indicating when this Metadata was last updated in the metadata schema store.

owner.description: The API user who owns this Schema.

MonitoringTaskSummary.title: MonitoringTaskSummary
MonitoringTaskSummary.description: A compressed description of a monitoring task

active.description: Whether this monitor is currently active.

frequency.description: The interval in minutes on which this monitor will run. Minimum is 5. Default is 720.

internalUsername.description: Internal user account used to perform the check.

target.description: The id of the sytem to be monitored. This must be an active system registered with the Systems service.

updateSystemStatus.description: Whether this Monitor should update the system status when the results change. You must have the ADMIN role on the target system to use this feature.

id.description: The unique id of the monitor

MonitoringTaskCheck.title: MonitoringTaskCheck
MonitoringTaskCheck.description: An individual check made for a monitoring task.

created.description: A timestamp indicating when this monitor check was created.

id.description: The UUID for this monitor check.

message.description: The error message if this monitor check failed.

result.description: The results of this monitor check.

associatedUuid.description: UUID of resource to whome the event applies.

url.description: The url or email address that will be notified of the event.

persistent.description: Whether this notification should stay active after it fires the first time.

created.description: The creation date in ISO 8601 format.

creator.description: The api user who made the PostIt creation request.

expires.description: The expiration date in ISO 8601 format.

internalUsername.description: The username of the internal user attached to this PostIt.

method.description: The url that will be invoked when the PostIt is redeemed.

remainingUses.description: The number of invocations remaining on this token.

url.description: The url that will be invoked when the PostIt is redeemed.

noauth.description: If true, the provided url will be called without authentication. Default is false

url.description: The url that will be invoked when the PostIt is redeemed.

internalUsername.description: The username of the internal user attached to this PostIt.

method.description: The method that will be invoked when the PostIt is redeemed.

lifetime.description: The maximum lifetime in seconds of this PostIt on this token. Defaults to 2592000 (30 days)

maxUses.description: The maximum number of invocations remaining on this PostIt. Defaults to no limit

noauth.description: If true, the provided url will be called without authentication. Default is false

InternalUser.title: InternalUser
InternalUser.description: A virtual user profile associated with a concrete api user

parent.description: The uuid of the parent to which this internal user account belongs

created.description: The date the internal user was created

lastUpdated.description: The date the internal user was last updated

ProfileRequest.title: ProfileRequest
ProfileRequest.description: A profile describing a new user to be created.

email.description: The api user's unique email address.

gender.description: The api user's gender. male or female.

position.description: The api user's position of employment.

researchArea.description: The api user's primary area of research.

status.description: The api user's status. active or deleted.

password.description: The password to set for the new user

Profile.title: Profile
Profile.description: A user profile describing an actual user.

email.description: The api user's unique email address.

gender.description: The api user's gender. male or female.

position.description: The api user's position of employment.

researchArea.description: The api user's primary area of research.

password.description: The password to set for this profile

customDirectives.description: Any custom directives that should be appended to scheduler directives. ex. #$ -A TG-12345

isDefault.description: Is this the default queue for the system.

maxJobs.description: The maximum number of jobs that can be in queue at once.

maxUserJobs.description: The maximum number of jobs per user that can be in queue at once.

maxNodes.description: The max nodes available per node to jobs submitted to this queue.

maxMemoryPerNode.description: The max memory available per node to jobs submitted to this queue.

maxProcessorsPerNode.description: The max processors per node available to jobs submitted to this queue.

maxRequestedTime.description: The max length of jobs submitted to this queue in hhh:mm:ss format.

name.description: The name of the batch queue.

auth.description: The default authentication credential used for this system.

host.description: The hostname or ip address of the submission server

port.description: The port number of the submission server.

protocol.description: The protocol used to authenticate to the submission server.

auth.description: The default authentication credential used for this system.

containerName.description: The name of the bucket to interact with when using an object store.

homeDir.description: The path on the remote system to use as the home directory for all API requests. For cases where the home directory should be dynamically defined, the ${USERNAME} token can be included in the homeDir value to represent the username of the authenticated user. ex. /home/${USERNAME}.

host.description: The hostname or ip address of the storage server

port.description: The port number of the storage server.

mirror.description: Whether the permissions set on the server should be pushed to the storage system itself. This only applies to IRODS and AWS systems.

protocol.description: The protocol used to authenticate to the storage server.

publicAppsDir.description: The path on the remote system where apps will be stored if this is set as the default public storage system.

resource.description: The name of the target resource when defining an IRODS system.

rootDir.description: The path on the remote system to use as the root for all API requests.

zone.description: The name of the zone when defining an IRODS system.

SystemCredential.title: SystemCredential
SystemCredential.description: Authentication credential for the default or internal user on a system

credential.description: The credential used to authenticate to the remote system. Depending on the authentication protocol of the remote system, this could be an OAuth Token, X.509 certificate, Kerberose token, or an private key..

expirationDate.description: The date the credential expires in ISO 8601 format.

internalUsername.description: The username of the internal user associated with this credential.

isDefault.description: Is this the default credential for this internal user of this type on this system?

parentType.description: The system type this credential is associated with.

password.description: The password on the remote system used to authenticate.

publicKey.description: The public ssh key used to authenticate to the remote system.

privateKey.description: The public ssh key used to authenticate to the remote system..

server.description: The server from which a credential may be obtained.

username.description: The local username on the remote system used to authenticate.

valid.description: Is the credential still valid or has it expired?.

caCerts.description: A public URL to the location of the trusted CA certs to use with this credential.

isDefault.description: Is the system the default for the authenticated user?

status.description: The status of this system. Systems must be in UP status to be used.

environment.description: Environment variables to set upon login prior to job submission.

isDefault.description: Is the system the default for the authenticated user?

lastModified.description: The date this system was last modified in ISO 8601 format.

revision.description: The number of times this app has been updated.

scratchDir.description: The scratch directory where job execution directories will be created at runtime. The workDir is used if this is not specified.

site.description: The site associated with this system.

status.description: The status of this system. Systems must be in UP status to be used.

storage.description: The storage config defining how to connect to this system for data staging.

environment.description: Environment variables to set upon login prior to job submission.

executionType.description: The execution paradigm used to run jobs on this system.

login.description: The login config defining how to connect to this system for job submission.

maxSystemJobs.description: The maximum number of jobs that can be simultaneously run on the system across all queues.

maxSystemJobsPerUser.description: The maximum number of jobs that can be simultaneously run on the system across all queues by a single user.

queues.description: The execution paradigm used to run jobs on this system.

scheduler.description: The type of scheduled used to run jobs.

scratchDir.description: The scratch directory where job execution directories will be created at runtime. The workDir is used if this is not specified.

site.description: The site associated with this system.

startupScript.description: Script to be run after login and prior to execution.

status.description: The functional status of this system. Systems must be in UP status to be used.

storage.description: The storage config defining how to connect to this system for data staging.

workDir.description: The work directory where job execution directories will be created at runtime. This is used if scratchDir is not specified. If neither are specified, the job directory will be created in the system homeDir.

ExecutionSystem.title: ExecutionSystem
ExecutionSystem.description: Represents a system used for running Application codes. Also has the ability to store data and participate in transfer operations.

executionType.description: The execution paradigm used to run jobs on this system.

login.description: The login config defining how to connect to this system for job submission.

maxSystemJobs.description: The maximum number of jobs that can be simultaneously run on the system across all queues.

maxSystemJobsPerUser.description: The maximum number of jobs that can be simultaneously run on the system across all queues by a single user.

queues.description: The execution paradigm used to run jobs on this system.

scheduler.description: The type of scheduled used to run jobs.

scratchDir.description: The scratch directory where job execution directories will be created at runtime. The workDir is used if this is not specified.

workDir.description: The work directory where job execution directories will be created at runtime. This is used if scratchDir is not specified. If neither are specified, the job directory will be created in the system homeDir.

startupScript.description: Script to be run after login and prior to execution.

result.description: All matching roles for this system

credential.description: The credential used to authenticate to the remote system. Depending on the authentication protocol of the remote system, this could be an OAuth Token, X.509 certificate, Kerberose token, or an private key..

internalUsername.description: The username of the internal user associated with this credential.

password.description: The password on the remote system used to authenticate.

publicKey.description: The public ssh key used to authenticate to the remote system.

privateKey.description: The public ssh key used to authenticate to the remote system..

server.description: The server from which a credential may be obtained.

username.description: The local username on the remote system used to authenticate.

caCerts.description: A public URL to the location of the trusted CA certs to use with this credential.

endpoint.description: The hostname or ip address of the remote server.

port.description: The port number of the remote server..

protocol.description: The protocol used to obtain a credential from the remote server.

SystemActionType.title: SystemActionType
SystemActionType.description: The actions available on a system.

SystemAction.title: SystemAction
SystemAction.description: A generic action to apply to a system

action.description: Action to perform on the system.

decoders.description: The available decoders for this transform.

descriptionurl.description: The URL to find out more information.

enabled.description: Whether this transform is enabled or not.

encoder.description: The encoder to use to convert to this format.

nativeFormat.description: The original file type of the file. If not given, the file type is assumed to be raw.

url.description: The uri to which the transformed file will be staged.

callbackUrl.description: The URI to notify when the transfer is complete. This can be an email address or http URL. If a URL is given, a GET will be made to this address. URL templating is supported. Valid template values are: ${NAME}, ${SOURCE_FORMAT}, ${DEST_FORMAT}, ${STATUS}

ApplicationArgumentDataSemantics.title: ApplicationArgumentDataSemantics
ApplicationArgumentDataSemantics.description: Describes the semantic definition of this inputs and the filetypes it represents. Multiple ontologies and values are supported.

fileTypes.description: The file types acceptable for this input.

ApplicationArgumentSemantics.title: ApplicationArgumentSemantics
ApplicationArgumentSemantics.description: Describes the semantic definition of this input/output and the filetypes it represents. Multiple ontologies and values are supported. Read more.

fileTypes.description: The file types acceptable for this output.

maxCardinality.description: The maximum number of times this output may appear.

minCardinality.description: The minimum number of times this output may appear. -1 is unlimited

ApplicationOutput.title: ApplicationOutput
ApplicationOutput.description: In addition to describing the inputs and parameters that your wrapper script requires, it is often helpful to provide the expected outputs when running your app. This is the purpose of the outputs attribute. App outputs specify an array of JSON objects describing the data that should be present when your app completes. It is entirely optional and provided, at this point in time, for reference purpose only. Read more.

ApplicationParameter.title: ApplicationParameter
ApplicationParameter.description: App parameters define the command-line arguments (flags, arguments, etc.) needed by your wrapper script in order to properly run your application code. Read more.

value.description: The inputs files for this parameter.

ApplicationArgument.title: ApplicationArgument
ApplicationArgument.description: This is the base model for all Application input, output, and parameter objects.

id.description: The id of this argument. This will be the replacement string in your wrapper scripts.

semantics.description: The semantic information for this output.

value.description: The validation and type information for this argument.

ApplicationParameterType.title: ApplicationParameterType
ApplicationParameterType.description: The primary type of the application

ApplicationParameterEnumValueItem.title: ApplicationParameterEnumValueItem
ApplicationParameterEnumValueItem.description: Enumerated single attribute object representing an enumeration value for an ApplicationParamaeterEnumValue. While a single pimary type may be specified, an ApplicationParameterEnumValueItem is the recommended structure as it allows for better display for consumers rendering enumerated values as HTML select elemetns.

value.description: The value of the enumeration to display in a dropdown list

SystemRoleRequest.title: SystemRoleRequest
SystemRoleRequest.description: A basic role granted to a user for a particular system

username.description: The username of the api user granted this role.

TransferTaskProgressSummary.title: TransferTaskProgressSummary
TransferTaskProgressSummary.description: This represents a rollup of a data transfer operation.

source.description: The source URL of the transfer operation

totalActiveTransfers.description: The number of concurrent transfers behind this transfer task

totalBytes.description: The total number of bytes to be transferred

totalBytesTransferred.description: The total number of bytes transferred thus far

totalFiles.description: The total number of files transferred to date

uuid.description: The id of the transfer task associated with this object

description.description: The description of what this encoder is and what it does.

FileMkdirAction.title: FileMkdirAction
FileMkdirAction.description: Request for a new directory to be created on the target system. This will recursively create missing directories.

path.description: Absolute or relative path of the new directory

FileRenameAction.title: FileRenameAction
FileRenameAction.description: Request for a file/folder to be renamed on the target system. Metadata will be preserved after rename. Rename operations are only applied relative to the file/folder given in the URL. To rename a file/folder to a different path, see the FileMoveAction.

path.description: New name of the file or folder specified in the URL.

FileMoveAction.title: FileMoveAction
FileMoveAction.description: Request for a file/folder to be moved on the target system. Metadata will be preserved after move.

path.description: The relative or absolute path of the renamed file/folder.

FileCopyAction.title: FileCopyAction
FileCopyAction.description: Request for a file/folder to be copied on the target system. Metadata will be appended to the destination if it already exists. Otherwise, a new history will be created.

path.description: New name of the file or folder specified in the URL.

append.description: True if the contents of the source file should be appended to the end of file given in the URL.

description.description: The description of what this decoder is and what it does.

ApplicationAction.title: ApplicationAction
ApplicationAction.description: Generic action to take on an app

ApplicationPublishAction.title: ApplicationPublishAction
ApplicationPublishAction.description: Publishes an app into the public space for anyone to use.

name.description: The new name of the app after publication

version.description: The new version of the app after publication

executionSystem.description: The id of the public system on which this app will run after publication

ApplicationCloneAction.title: ApplicationCloneAction
ApplicationCloneAction.description: Clones an existing app for private use.

name.description: The new name of the app after cloning

version.description: The new version of the app after cloning

executionSystem.description: The id of the private system on which this app will run after publication

deploymentSystem.description: The id of the system on which the app assets will be stored after cloning

deploymentPath.description: The path on the deployment system where the app assets will be copied during cloning

ApplicationEnableAction.title: ApplicationEnableAction
ApplicationEnableAction.description: Make a disabled application available once again.

ApplicationUnpublishAction.title: ApplicationUnpublishAction
ApplicationUnpublishAction.description: Removes an app from the public scope.

FileType.title: FileType
FileType.description: The type of the remote file/folder

JobStopAction.title: JobStopAction
JobStopAction.description: Requests that a currently active job be killed.

JobResubmitAction.title: JobResubmitAction
JobResubmitAction.description: Resubmits the given job as a new job with a unique id. The archive system and path are reset. All other fields remain unchanged. Notifications set for the original job will not carry over.

MonitoringTaskDetails.title: MonitoringTaskDetails
MonitoringTaskDetails.description: Detailed description of a monitoring task

id.description: The unique id of the monitoring task

lastSuccess.description: The last time the monitoring task had a successful check

lastUpdated.description: The last time the monitor was updated

nextUpdate.description: The next time the check will run

owner.description: The user who created the monitoring task

lastCheck.description: A summary of the result of the last check run for this monitoring task

StorageSystem.title: StorageSystem
StorageSystem.description: Represents a storage system used for data movement and transfer operations.

FilePermission.title: FilePermission
FilePermission.description: A permission grant for a single file or folder.

permission.description: The permisisons associated with this objectf

recursive.description: Boolean flag indicating whether the permission applies recursively to the remote file item.

Permission.title: Permission
Permission.description: A generic permission applied to any resource in the API

username.description: The username to whom this permission grant applies

internalUsername.description: The internal user associated with this permission

permission.description: The permissions granted to the user

created.description: The date the permission was created

lastUpdated.description: The date the permission was last updated

id.description: The unique id of this permission

FilePermissionStanza.title: FilePermissionStanza
FilePermissionStanza.description: A permission object describing read, write, and execute permission for a file item.

SystemRole.title: SystemRole
SystemRole.description: A role granted a user on a system

username.description: The username to whom the role applies.

role.description: The role granted to the suer

created.description: The date the role was first granted

lastUpdated.description: The date the role was last updated.

id.description: The unique id of this role grant

SystemPublishAction.title: SystemPublishAction
SystemPublishAction.description: Promote the system into the public space for all tenant users to utilize as a shared resource.

SystemCloneAction.title: SystemCloneAction
SystemCloneAction.description: Clone an existing system as a new system. Auth credentials will not be cloned on the new system.

HistoryEvent.title: HistoryEvent
HistoryEvent.description: A generic history event representing a change on a resource or one of its associations.

description.description: A brief description of the event details.

status.description: The status of the file/folder after this event.

progress.description: A summary progress report of the transfer operation associated with this file event, if any.

FileImportRequest.title: FileImportRequest
FileImportRequest.description: File import request to copy a file from an accessible URL.

fileType.description: The file format this file is in. Defaults to raw. This will be used in file transform operations.

notifications.description: Notifications to set with the successful acceptance of this upload request

fileName.description: The name to give the upload file. If unset, takes the original file name.

append.description: Boolean flag indicating this file should be appended to the target file

urlToImport.description: The URL to import the file from. This parameter is used if not file is uploaded with this post.

UUIDRequest.description: Request object to create a new UUID

type.description: The resource type for which the UUID should be created.

UUIDSummary.description: Resource to which a tag has been associated

UUIDResolution.description: Resource to which a tag has been associated

type.description: the resource type represented by this uuid

representation.description: the full object representation for this uuid
